comments: Can be removed when integrated into DataCite. For versioning this schema until then.

examples: "The ABC Maturity Check consists of 11 metrics, which test …"

Definition: The general type of the resource
is the metric machine-readable / can it be automatically evaluated

comments: If the check consists of several metrics, which each an own definition, URIs to individual metric definitions can be provided via 99.11.3

Definition: URI of the name identfier schema

comments: Commonly, more than one person/organization is involved -- but, at least one. Question: How to link data to publications when both were reviewer by the same process?

Definition: information on who performed the quality assurance
comments: similarities to DataCite Metadata Schema Property 2 "Creator"

Definition: function of person/organization in the context of this dataset
allowed values, other constraints: CV: [creator, publisher, data provider, external reviewer, contributor]

examples: "Josiah Carberry", "Global Data Repository on Psychoceramics Research"

comments: person or institution identifier scheme; see DataCite Metadata Schema 2.4.a "nameIdentifierSchema"

Definition: URI of the name identfier schema
date when the evaluation was performed
provide result report for the check

examples: "This dataset performed outstanding with respect to the ABC Maturity Evaluation … ."

Definition: URI to a evaluation report or a similar document
URI of the name identfier schema

comments: One maturity check might consist of several metrics (e.g. one metric for each aspect of FAIRness)
name of the metric within the metric schema
examples: "Check for persistent identifier", "Maturity Check for Consistency"

comments: ID of the metric within the metric schema
If each metric of the particular check has an individual definition, this can be provided here.

Definition: URI of the name identfier schema
evaluation results of one indicator of the metric
comments: for storing evaluation result in DataCite metadata
unit of the value provided in …MetricResult
examples: "%", "level of 5" (if ...MetricResult was "4", we would get "level 4 of 5"), "points", "1" (dimensionless), "levels A to E with A best and E worst"
